title: Problem-Situation-Based Mathematical Talent Development Program

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary arithmetic operations and problem-solving reasoning skills
context.additional_context: A collaborative learning course where professionals acquire creative problem-solving strategies applicable to elementary math education, operating in a smartphone-centric environment.

learning_goals: Learners can design problem-solving strategies using four creative thinking functions (technique generation, technique optimization, multidimensional approach, technique application) in problem situations related to infinite sequences
Learners can present three or more alternative solutions to mathematical problems through peer collaboration
Learners can document and evaluate the problem-solving process in three stages (analysis-strategy development-execution) when performing project-based tasks

resources: Visual Thinking Templates for Creative Thinking Facilitation
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
